comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I'm about 98% certain that we see bridge engineer/designer Ralph Freeman on the rhs in this pic. Compare the pics of Freeman here investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... with the gent on the rhs (zoom in at the purl version). The chap in the centre is of course Lawrence Ennis, Dorman Long & Co's director of construction, with JJC Bradfield between Ennis and Freeman. I suspect that the chap 2nd from the lhs wearing the bow-tie also features in this pic www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/8283744212/in/pho... As yet there aren't too many digitised pics of Freeman in the various collections, so this pic is quite notable on that count.

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: Thanks [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02]  for correction re Lawrence Ennis.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Ennis certainly looks to have had Lang like proportions.

comment._content: Freeman also appears in this pic - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/8282689273/

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: It should also be mentioned that this is where one quarter of the weight of the bridge arch will be borne, the "skewback" of the arch. There were two north and two south.
